page.title: 01WHALTON, NORTHUMBERLAND.
page.content: Whalton is an attractive Northumbrian village of grey sandstone houses, built on either side of the Morpeth_ Belsay road, the B6524. It lies 18 miles to the northwest of Newcastle upon Tyne and 6 miles to the southwest of Morpeth, County Town of Northumberland. The population of Whalton village is around 160. There is a village green surrounded by posts and chains on the north side of the road and it is here that the annual Baal Fire is held. The focal points of village life are the shop, the village hall, the church and the pub. The village is surrounded by fairly flat intensively farmed open countryside and agriculture is the most important aspect of life for this community.
